dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan b Shaheen Shah Afridi 67 (56b 2x4 5x6) SR: 119.64

dismissalComment.html: If they won't catch, hit the stumps length ball, coming into the batsman. Asghar has been targetting that six over midwicket all over long, this time, he misses and the slower ball hits the stumps. Shaheen Afridi has a wicket on ODI debut. Much deserved. Would have been a travesty if he had ended up wicketless thanks to dropped catches

dismissalComment.html: dolly, and finally taken he perhaps thought that was coming in with the angle and tried to whip it, only got a tame leading edge back to the bowler. The bowler reaped the rewards of tying the batsman down. Ishanullah was looking to break free, and didn't look comfortable doing it

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: got im! flighted ball, gets it to turn enough to beat an ambitious drive and Sarfraz takes a smart catch behind the stumps off the thin edge. Feet didn't move at all from the batsman

headshotImage.caption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Rahmat Shah player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: fumbles but holds on! Nawaz almost ruins it for himself as he gets under a top-edge, but he takes it at the second attempt. Such a good pace on that ball. Loopy dipper on middle stump at a length, beats the batsman in flight - he is looking to sweep but the ball is not full enough. Some grip and turn away and a rash shot from a usually solid batsman. He's gone for 36, Pakistan have an opening.

dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq run out (Najibullah Zadran) 80 (104b 5x4 1x6) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: direct hit and Afghanistan think they have Imam! This looks very good. Yes, he's gone. By a yard, at least. Najibullah with the brilliant work from point. Sprint, stoop, pick-up and BOOM. Knocked down the stumps at the non-striker's end as Imam looked to steal another single with a soft-handed poke off the front foot. Is that the drinks break's doing? Possible lapse of judgement? Doesn't matter really, with that work in the field, he deserved the run-out. Good innings from Imam, but he'll be cross for not taking it closer.

dismissalText.long: st Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan
dismissalText.commentary: Babar Azam st Mohammad Shahzad b Rashid Khan 66 (94b 4x4 1x6) SR: 70.21

dismissalComment.html: this looks out too! A stumping appeal has been sent upstairs. Full and drifted in outside off. Babar looks to drive but this rips rapidly past his outside edge because he hasn't got to the crease. His back leg had dragged out...and Shahzad's quick hands means Babar is gone too. Like a flash, the Afghan keeper. Stunning, stunning work. Rashid Khan has come steaming in and stolen another moment for himself.

headshotImage.longCaption: Asif Ali player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: taken at long-off! The revenge of the spinner! Holds his index finger up and stares into the batsman's eyes as he walks off. Full fizzing legbreak wide outside off, Asif has his front leg well outside leg stump. He won't get leverage for this because his weight is all over the place. Slices it off the toe and a reverse-cup from Aftab Alam out at the boundary

dismissalComment.html: smashes middle and leg! Short of a length and he ends up swinging from over it. It's never easy to play horizontal bat shots against him. But it's what he needed to do. Couldn't get bat on it.

dismissalComment.html: big appeal and it's given! Oh that looked to be both an inside edge and striking him outside off...although Zaman didn't take the review immediately so we could rule the edge out. He was looking to sweep this full ball outside of...and yes, he was struck outside off. Chooses not to review after a chat with Imam and Pakistan have lost one very early

headshotImage.caption: Haris Sohail headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Haris Sohail headshot

dismissalComment.html: taken at long-on. Haris is done by the googly. It's a short ball that he expects to spin into him from off stump, so he's opened his stance and is looking to pull with that angle towards midwicket. But the googly squares him up and he ends up slicing an easy one out to Ishanullan

dismissalText.commentary: Sarfaraz Ahmed b Gulbadin Naib 8 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: but he won't succeed! Out of sorts all innings long. Makes room and misses a full toss that's headed for middle stump. It was there for a slog, it was there for a chop, it was...well, he could've really done anything with that. But he chose to back away and nudge it behind square and when the ball dips from waist height, that's a risky shot - to offer so little of the bat to it. He's gone and once more, we sway.

commentTextItems.html: that's it! Malik swipes it to the fine leg boundary and wins it for Pakistan with his 43-ball fifty. Aftab is on his haunces, covering his face and possibly in tears. But this is all Malik, he's engineered this to perfection. Looked for the yorker, it was off slightly, a leg stump overpitched ball and it was an easy put away

commentPostTextItems.html: 12:13am Whew. Is that the game that kicks life into the rest of this tournament? It was much needed, as was tomorrow's break. For you, for the players, and for us commentators too. It's been a crazy night. We'll see you when the tournament resumes. Thanks for joining today, we hope you enjoyed it. On behalf of Saurabh and Thilak - have a good night!

Shoaib Malik: Well, Rameez bhai, being a senior player when you've played enough cricket, you know when you already have a start, the goal is to bat till the 50th over. That's the only thing I had in mind. At one point the required rate was almost ten but I kept telling myself to bat till the end because we had batsmen to hit the big shots later. I think even the good bowlers, when they're bowling in the middle overs, they are confident and want to get you out. But in the end, even they are on the back foot. As a batsman, you can show authority on them. I would like to congratulate them [Afghanistan] though, they have been improving every day. ["I need that," he says when Rameez Raja mentions the rest day tomorrow.]
Shoaib Malik is the Man of the Match.

Sarfraz Ahmed: We were completely rocked by the end. Credit should go to Babar and Imam and we can't praise Malik enough. Afghanistan batted very sensibly, and they have the best three spinners in the world. Especially on these pitches. Anyone who chases against them will have to do really well, and we did. Unfortunately Shadab failed the fitness test this morning and we were a bowler short, but the batting was strengthened. Once again, I can't praise Malik enough. It wasn't easy to chase 257 on this and the way Babar and Imam showed patience before Malik, it'll give us a lot of confidence. After a long time, about 18 months, we had a terrible fielding day. We'll have to address that.

Asghar Afghan: First I want to congratulate Pakistan. Yeah today was tough and thrilling. I think it's the first in this tournament that the game was this tough., it was good for the crowd I will give a lot of credit to Babar and Imam. If Malik [Shahzad catch] had been taken, it would have been easy for us. But when you give a chance to a mature batsman, it becomes difficult. Today Hashmat and I played really well, because we wanted 240+. But our fielding didn't work today along with our seam bowling. I think on this kind of wicket, Rashid is difficult. That's why we went with him, but they played very well.

Farooq: "Great match, pure love for the Afghans. They are great ambassadors for their land. Their time will come. "

Meezan: "Great to see yet another good team emerging from the sub continent. Afghanistan has earned respect of the cricketing world with their Asia Cup performances. Welcome to the big league boys."

Hadi: "Brilliant just brilliant to see Malik and Hasan getting down to console the bowler and Malik giving a hug to Shahzad. Great sportsmanship. "

Hadi: "Finally an amazing thriller of a match in an otherwise bizarre tournament setup! AFG lost but played like champions and for sure will give India a tough day as well"

Moazam: "Believe me, it's not easy to be a Pakistani and a Pakistani fan. Been skipping my heartbeats. Made my heartbeats so fast during the last 5 overs but its worth it at the end . Phewwww"

Benny: "In his own special way, Shoaib Malik is the goat"

Jay Padia: "Shoaib Malik's innings was akin to M S Dhoni of yore. Take it to the end, keep one end secure, let others hit a six and when it matters, finish it off in style. Good fight, Afghanistan and good wrap, Pakistan!"

Caleb: "For what was pretty good death bowling on the whole, there were just too many six balls towards the end. Missed opportunity for Afghanistan and it's the small margins at the highest level, but that game was winner take a top 2 finish in all likelihood "

Muhammad Omer D: "What a match... Well done Afghanistan.. Congratulations Pakistan"

Vipul : "Rashid Khan is the Neil Johnson of Afghanistan. Typically contributes the most and sees it all washed away."

Abdullah Iqbal: "Six of Asif , Six of Nawaz , Six of Hasan , Six of Malik. The tale of 4 sixes <3"

11:51 It's really Malik's experience trumping Afghanistan's inexperience. With his shot selection, with his calculations, and with his instructions to the lower-order batsmen, Malik brought the game where he wanted it to be: in the last over against a not-so-confident seamer. And boy did he punish him.
Before that, Imam and Babar with a 154-run stand that should have made this a lot easier than it was. But is it even Pakistan if this isn't how it's done? A three wicket win.

commentTextItems.html: bowl me what you want, says the old hero, I'm going to send you away. It's short of a length, it's a slower ball, it sits up and he whips it over deep square. Bad, bad ball.

commentPostTextItems.html: Aarish Mustafa: "@Haseeb how do you know malik isn't playing for his fifty here ;)"

commentPreTextItems.html: 10 off 6. Shoaib Malik is on strike. The strategy meetings have begun., Short fine, point, extra cover and mid-off are the fielders inside. Does that mean a short of a length strategy?

commentTextItems.html: overpitched ball outside off and he misses out! Extra cover and mid-off in but he mistimes the drive. Sends Hasan back too
narrowly misses off stump. Rashid is mad at himself. It's another googly, Hasan swipes across the line and misses. But he's done his job

commentPostTextItems.html: Haseeb: "Will the 2 runs denied at last 2 balls of Afghan innings make the difference? This is what happens when personal milestones are more precious than teams good."

commentTextItems.html: he has swing it over wide long-on! This is excellent strategy. It has to be the guy at the other end who has to take on Rashid. Malik gives Hasan the license, Hasan uses it to club a googly with the slog sweep

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nawaz b Rashid Khan 10 (8b 0x4 1x6) SR: 125

commentTextItems.html: smashes middle and leg! Short of a length and he ends up swinging from over it. It's never easy to play horizontal bat shots against him. But it's what he needed to do. Couldn't get bat on it.
inside half as he steps out and cuts out the room for himself. Sort of yorks himself at a leg stump line and can only drag it out to deep midwicket
length and into his body. Drags it with the turn to deep square leg
yorker just outside off, jammed pitch side into the off side

commentPostTextItems.html: Wow that six has made such a big difference. They'll back themselves to get 12-13 in the last over if they can see off Rashid here. Or will Nawaz go after him right away? Won't be a bad option...

commentTextItems.html: clears the long-on boundary with a sensational slog! That is pure, unadulterated, old-fashioned swinging through the line and it's big, it's awesome and it's six. Aftab drops the slower ball short and it sits up for a spanking outside off. Nawaz sends it flying. Just hat was needed.
yorker gives nothing to Malik as he looks to make room. It's at leg stump and he can only jam it pitch-side
slices to sweeper's right. Full ball outside off, gets on one knee and can't find the boundary
offcutter at a length, in at off stump. Looks to swipe across the line and gets it down to long-on
full and into the stumps. Looks to drive through the off side but it comes back to the bowler off the toe-end
full outside off, leans in and drags this off the toe-end to deep midwicket's right. The bad connection allowing them the second

commentTextItems.html: taken at long-off! The revenge of the spinner! Holds his index finger up and stares into the batsman's eyes as he walks off. Full fizzing legbreak wide outside off, Asif has his front leg well outside leg stump. He won't get leverage for this because his weight is all over the place. Slices it off the toe and a reverse-cup from Aftab Alam out at the boundary
see you later! Oh what a hit! Googly pushed through a little flat, on a length at off stump and he has got down on one knee and smoked this 96 metres!

dismissalComment.html: fumbles but holds on! Nawaz almost ruins it for himself as he gets under a top-edge, but he takes it at the second attempt. Such a good pace on that ball. Loopy dipper on middle stump at a length, beats the batsman in flight - he is looking to sweep but the ball is not full enough. Some grip and turn away and a rash shot from a usually solid batsman. He's gone for 36, Pakistan have an opening.

dismissalText.commentary: Imam-ul-Haq run out (Najibullah Zadran) 80 (104b 5x4 1x6) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: direct hit and Afghanistan think they have Imam! This looks very good. Yes, he's gone. By a yard, at least. Najibullah with the brilliant work from point. Sprint, stoop, pick-up and BOOM. Knocked down the stumps at the non-striker's end as Imam looked to steal another single with a soft-handed poke off the front foot. Is that the drinks break's doing? Possible lapse of judgement? Doesn't matter really, with that work in the field, he deserved the run-out. Good innings from Imam, but he'll be cross for not taking it closer.

dismissalComment.html: this looks out too! A stumping appeal has been sent upstairs. Full and drifted in outside off. Babar looks to drive but this rips rapidly past his outside edge because he hasn't got to the crease. His back leg had dragged out...and Shahzad's quick hands means Babar is gone too. Like a flash, the Afghan keeper. Stunning, stunning work. Rashid Khan has come steaming in and stolen another moment for himself.

dismissalComment.html: but he won't succeed! Out of sorts all innings long. Makes room and misses a full toss that's headed for middle stump. It was there for a slog, it was there for a chop, it was...well, he could've really done anything with that. But he chose to back away and nudge it behind square and when the ball dips from waist height, that's a risky shot - to offer so little of the bat to it. He's gone and once more, we sway.

milestones.description: This is the highest match aggregate (515) involving teams Pakistan & Afghanistan in ODIs
Gulbadin Naib has broken the record for most ducks (5) in ODIs for AFG, going past Dawlat Zadran's 5
Shahzad has scored 16 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for AFG breaking Rahmat Shah's record
Rashid Khan has become the top wicket-taker for AFG in ODIs with 115 wickets, going past Mohammad Nabi's 112
